alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings (Brooklyn); New York (Manhattan); Northern Queens; Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Richmond (Staten Is.); Rockland; Southern Queens; Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 9:23PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hudson, eastern Passaic, Union, Bergen, Essex, eastern Orange, western Putnam, Queens, Bronx, Richmond, Kings, Rockland, Westchester and New York (Manhattan) Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Gardnertown to near Oakwood. Movement of the line was east at 15 mph. Multiple areas of embedded showers and thunderstorms are rapidly moving northward along this line. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newark, Jersey City, Yonkers, Paterson, Elizabeth, Flatbush, Flushing, Passaic, Bayonne, Wayne, Mott Haven, Hoboken, Bloomfield, East Tremont and Hackensack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
